DataElement.preferredDefinition: The named locations of a benign or malignant pathologic structure in a soft tissue melanoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells._The anatomic site of the tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells.

Property.preferredDefinition: The anatomic site of the tumor.

Concepts.definition: The anatomic site of the tumor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/2/20 jk Released per CPTAC SME (Linda) for PRAD Baseline CRF.   7/26/19 jk revised OC concept per CPTAC input.  6/26/19 jk created for CPTAC Baseline CRFs.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A malignant, usually aggressive tumor composed of atypical, neoplastic melanocytes. Most often, melanomas arise in the skin (cutaneous melanomas) and include the following histologic subtypes: superficial spreading melanoma, nodular melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma. Cutaneous melanomas may arise from acquired or congenital melanocytic or dysplastic nevi. Melanomas may also arise in other anatomic sites including the gastrointestinal system, eye, urinary tract, and reproductive system. Melanomas frequently metastasize to lymph nodes, liver, lungs, and brain._Named locations of or within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the area underneath a finger nail or toe nail.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the area underneath a finger nail or toe nail.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Palms of Hands and Soles of Feet

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Palms of Hands and Soles of Feet
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The palmar aspect of the hands and the bottoms of the feet.

Concepts.longName: Palms of Hands and Soles of Feet
Concepts.definition: The palmar aspect of the hands and the bottoms of the feet.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Body limbs, consisting of right upper and lower (arm and leg) and left upper and lower (arm and leg). (CADSR)

Concepts.definition: Body limbs, consisting of right upper and lower (arm and leg) and left upper and lower (arm and leg). (CADSR)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The body excluding the head and neck and limbs.

Concepts.definition: The body excluding the head and neck and limbs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

Concepts.definition: For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

Concepts.definition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A malignant, usually aggressive tumor composed of atypical, neoplastic melanocytes. Most often, melanomas arise in the skin (cutaneous melanomas) and include the following histologic subtypes: superficial spreading melanoma, nodular melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma. Cutaneous melanomas may arise from acquired or congenital melanocytic or dysplastic nevi. Melanomas may also arise in other anatomic sites including the gastrointestinal system, eye, urinary tract, and reproductive system. Melanomas frequently metastasize to lymph nodes, liver, lungs, and brain.:Named locations of or within the body.

Concepts.definition: A malignant, usually aggressive tumor composed of atypical, neoplastic melanocytes. Most often, melanomas arise in the skin (cutaneous melanomas) and include the following histologic subtypes: superficial spreading melanoma, nodular melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma. Cutaneous melanomas may arise from acquired or congenital melanocytic or dysplastic nevi. Melanomas may also arise in other anatomic sites including the gastrointestinal system, eye, urinary tract, and reproductive system. Melanomas frequently metastasize to lymph nodes, liver, lungs, and brain.
Named locations of or within the body.
